meta.description: College production model for draft class generation

implementation_hints.draft_class_generation:
To generate a realistic draft class:

                1. Use conference_weights to distribute prospects across conferences
                   - SEC: ~22%, Big Ten: ~18%, ACC: ~12%, Big 12: ~10%
                   - Group of 5: ~15%, Other: ~23%

                2. Use school_weights within each conference
                   - Top schools (Alabama, Ohio St, Georgia) produce 2-4% each
                   - Mid-tier P5 schools produce 0.5-1% each

                3. Use position_by_conference for school specialties
                   - SEC: Strong at RB, LB, CB
                   - Big Ten: Strong at OL, DL
                   - ACC: Strong at WR, EDGE

                4. Use hit_rates_by_round for prospect quality
                   - Power 5 R1: 75% starter rate
                   - Group of 5 R1: 55% starter rate
                   - Power 5 R7: 15% starter rate
implementation_hints.school_flavor:
For narrative richness, tag schools with archetypes:
                - "QB Factory": USC, Oklahoma, Alabama
                - "O-Line U": Wisconsin, Iowa, Notre Dame
                - "WR U": Alabama, Ohio St, Clemson
                - "DB U": LSU, Florida, Ohio St
                - "Edge Factory": Clemson, Ohio St, Georgia
implementation_hints.variability_guidance:
For realistic draft class generation with variability:

1. PICKS PER SCHOOL PER DRAFT:
   - Alabama: 8-9 picks (std 1.7)
   - Top 10 schools: 5-7 picks (std 2-3)
   - Most schools: 0-2 picks per draft
   
2. SCHOOL POOL SIZE:
   - ~100 unique schools per draft
   - Top 24 schools produce 44% of all picks
   - 79 schools have exactly 1 pick in 15 years

3. GEM RATES BY ROUND:
   - R1: 40% Pro Bowl rate
   - R2: 19% Pro Bowl rate
   - R3: 11% Pro Bowl rate
   - R5-7: 3.2% Pro Bowl rate (late-round gems exist!)

4. BUST RATES BY ROUND:
   - R1: 2% bust rate
   - R4: 19% bust rate
   - R7: 35% bust rate

5. SMALL SCHOOL SURPRISE FACTOR:
   - 79 one-pick schools in 15 years
   - 8% of tiny school picks become Pro Bowlers
   - Generate 1-2 small school gems per class
